page.title: 14Sign of Things to Come (pt1)
page.content: We live in a very modern and industrious world. For some reason we are always wanting to improve. Computers are in the forefront of industry and pushing forward our achievments. In the 1940's the first computer was developed. It was hard to control and maintain, it was clumsy and broke down regularly. It was the size of the school hall and yet could only do simple mathematics (sums?). Today we can store the entire volumes of Encyclopedia Britannica on a laser disk. An impressive advance if you think about it. British Telecom is controlled by a vast amount of computer systems. The weather is processed on a huge computer which answers 300 million questions a second - or so they say.
